node.title: Should aged care workers be paid more? The union is hoping the Fair Work Commission says yes
node.description: The federal government has announced cash payments to try to retain aged care workers, but at the moment the Fair Work Commission is considering a case for substantially increasing wages. This is where it's up to so far.

node.title: 'It's a lot of money lost': How you can protect your super with the stock market plunging and interest rates rising
node.description: Australians have nervously watched their super balances plummet in recent weeks off the back of stock market falls. But there are steps people can take to protect their retirement nest egg.

node.title: Interest rates are tipped to rise later this year. So, is it time to fix your home loan?
node.description: While the Reserve Bank may have kept the official cash rate on hold this week, economists are predicting rates to rise before the end of the year.

node.title: Socceroos' hopes of World Cup qualification take a hit in Oman
node.description: The Socceroos are unlikely to secure automatic qualification to the World Cup after Oman secures a draw with a late penalty.

node.title: Why there's a COVID 'recalibration' coming — and how Australia will be affected
node.description: Experts predict 2022 will be the year COVID stops defining our lives — while the virus isn't going away, new treatments and ways of thinking could mark the beginning of the end.

node.title: New York Times buys hit word game Wordle
node.description: The New York Times has purchased the popular word game Wordle for an undisclosed seven-figure sum.

node.title: National Party calls for 'change in mindset' to cope with Omicron
node.description: National is calling for a new strategy as New Zealand prepares for a wave of Omicron cases, including opening the border immediately to fully vaccinated New Zealanders and twice weekly rapid antigen…

node.title: 'It's real serious': Fears crucial crop will deteriorate without foreign workers
node.description: A rural contractor has seen foreign workers give up on making it to New Zealand amid fears maize silage needing to be harvested soon will deteriorate with dire consequences for farmers. Audio

node.title: Westland, Buller residents warned ahead of heavy rain: 'Start thinking about a getaway bag'
node.description: Civil Defence emergency operation centres have opened in Westport and Hokitika as the region prepares for a deluge of heavy rain that could bring slips and flooding.

node.title: Charles Blow’s ‘Brave, Forthright and Searing’ Account of His Struggles
node.description: Readers praise the columnist’s candor. Also: America in retreat; worried Wordle fans; a dispute over a Native mascot.

node.title: Gunfire in Guinea-Bissau Prompts Fears of Another Coup in Africa
node.description: The small coastal country in West Africa has experienced four coups and at least a dozen attempted takeovers since it gained independence from Portugal nearly 50 years ago.

node.title: Americans quit their jobs at near-record rates amid Omicron
node.description: Layoffs hit a historic low in December as employers held on to the workers they have amid the "Great Resignation."

node.title: Claims sailors are enduring scorching conditions to repair 'stranded' Australian warship
node.description: Exhausted naval technicians claim they are battling temperatures of up to 50deg Celsius while trying to repair a crippled warship which also has a Covid-19 outbreak on board.

node.title: Australian PM says his government was too optimistic before Omicron surge
node.description: Australia's prime minister says his government had been too optimistic about the impact of Covid-19 vaccinations leading to disappointment and exhaustion when the Omicron variant hit.

node.title: Novavax could offer unvaccinated Americans a new option, if FDA agrees
node.description: Novavax's shots are based on a kind of "protein subunit" technology that has been used for decades in other routine vaccinations.
